description.narrative: Ser Educacional S.A. (Mauricio or the Company) is a for-profit higher education company providing undergraduate, graduate and technical education to students in the North and Northeast regions of Brazil. The Company has over 100,000 (including technical courses) students mainly from the middle and low income social classes. Maurício currently runs twenty-three campuses in eleven different states. Mauricio is undertaking a 2-year investment program (the Project), which comprises: (i) improvement of existing campuses; (ii) organic growth of current operations; (iii) distance learning (DL) implementation; and (iv) M&A combined with accelerated greenfield.

i. Raise quality standards: Strengthening Mauricio''s position as a leading education company in Northeastern and Northern Brazil will potentially serve as a catalyst for other leading education institutions, especially in those regions, to continue to raise the quality of their services; ii. Improve access to services in frontier regions: Mauricio''s plans to expand its network, particularly in frontier regions, will enhance Brazil''s education infrastructure and improve access to quality, affordable education services for low- and middle-income students. Larger national providers are also expected to follow Mauricio''s regional strategy of expansion in underdeveloped regions, thus further enhancing access to higher education and greater opportunities for employment; iii. Expand reach of community service activities: Mauricio''s expansion in number of enrolled students and into new states of Brazil will allow the Company to provide services to a larger population and a greater range of communities through students'' voluntary professional activities. Services include legal advice, health care (e.g. dental, medical, and physiotherapy), among others; iv. Create jobs: Mauricio''s expansion plan will benefit the labor market in Brazil''s frontier regions by creating both direct and indirect employment opportunities for local communities in construction and operation of the campuses; and v. Rationalize the market: The expansion of the Company through growing market share and selective acquisitions may help to consolidate the still fragmented education sector, potentially leading to rationalization and quality improvement in the industry.
